message: Programming is hard work. It’s an intense mental activity. Good programmers think about their work 24/7. They write their most important code in the shower and in their dreams.

data.message:
I disagree with every single word you just said :) A Good programmer is a Good Problem Solver Who Think about solving his problems without writing any single line of code. 

Writing code should be only an execution process when you write a code to the problem you already resolved in a documentation or on paper/Whiteboard. 

and once you get to this level writing code will not be that exciting. and you won't write as much code as you normally do. but the less code you write is the better approach to have less bugs.

your words is a reflection of what I've posted :)
you have said exactly what I meant by every word, that's why we (write) the most important in the shower, not with the keyboard :D
and you are in the Shower now? :D
